comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Brother of President Francisco Madero of Mexico. According to books.google.com/books?id=XAIcq6AJ3OwC&pg=RA1-PA674 (in a biography of Pancho Villa)

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT article of June 25, 1913, second article in query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9904E6DE153FE633A... Indicates that on June 24, 1913, a Salvador Madero and his brother, Ernesto, formed an import/export company in New York under the name Madero Brothers. However, NYT of Feb 9, 1918 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F04EEDE1F38E533A... indicates that the Madero Brothers were uncles of the former Mexican President. and NYT of April 21, 1918, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D05E7DC1F3FE433A... indicates that Ernesto of Madero Brothers is a nephew of the former president of Mexico. So there is definitely some potential for confusion here!!
